True that 👇🏻we’ve been able to grow quickly and not just keep, but improve quality of our work by this change in working patterns. On a day I’m rammed into someone’s armpit coming into london I in no way wonder at this fact. #remote #PR #growyourbusiness #entrepreneur https://t.co/9Ibkk8dbcO
@IsabelHardman I often find myself in agreement with you. But in this article I don’t think anyone can ‘argue elegantly’ about abortion. Quite a foul mouthed term.

@GeorgieAgass Ace to that! I remember that about same age, in similar circumstance, my mum used to leave me on the phone to my great nan (in Bude) when I lived in Kent! Whilst she did district nurse runs. Needs must :)

So this morning the kiddy alarm clock went off at 5am, I sprayed the water on the toilet brush into my face and mouth 😣, v. almost got run over (I wasn’t even on my phone at the time!)...things can only get better? #WednesdayThoughts
@RebeccaCNReid Ours went on two weeks ago. Sooo snuggly!
@RJ_Macpherson Ah it’s breath taking!
@msclews @laurenlaverne Happy anniversary to the lovers! Eleven years strong 💪🥂x
@LadyWrites_Blog @CArmstrongLDN Isn’t it?! Isn’t it just!! It’s like finding all your friends wrapped up in some sense and understanding. I demolished it whole.

When you’ve had 0 sleep. And 0 alcohol. And you realise hangovers are 99% tiredness 🤢jet lag + parenting = 😭

@GeorgieAgass @KateBurkeNHS @CArmstrongLDN One of the bits in the book that really spoke to me was about having to reset and resort what works for you and your family over and over again. I often feel I’m committed now - that’s it! But I now feel validated in my wanting to wiggle all the time :)
@keithgrimes @Dr_Ellie Bring British is basically making lots of teas for yourself and other people, that you then forget and have one cold sip from. #repeat

Shout out to the fab @KateBurkeNHS who’s reaching out to other working parents and creating a lovely community of shared pain / joy and juggle. #WednesdayWisdom #NHSComms #parenting https://t.co/4ZRfJBUgrL
@KateBurkeNHS Have you read @CArmstrongLDN new book? It’s like everything you’ve ever worried / thought / wondered laid out bare to scrutinise and find your own truth. Balm for the parenting souls!

@CharlotteSantry Congratulations on two counts!! Good luck and hope that baby comes soon x

Boarding a Delta airways flight - pre boarding for people with babies, those less able and current serving military. I 🤔 @British_Airways should introduce the same. Adding for those working in the NHS. That would be a good 70th anniversary present 💡 🎁 #nhscomms #NHS70 #PR https://t.co/5VkY39oIfB

Four phrases to cut out of your comms in you work in #healthtech 1.Real-time 2. Any device / anytime 3. Quality and efficiency 4. Right time right place These qualities are and should be ubiquitous . Any more I’ve missed? #DigitalTransformation #DigitalHealth
#complexmadeclear https://t.co/fBR3jmcWJ8

Is it wrong that the more you watch this the tastier it gets? I was balking at the sugar and salt content added - but I’m sure it’s nothing compared to standard takeaway. Clever campaign! https://t.co/2m2NkXDkBR

@JessAlice1992 Schools have awards for best attendance - its core to their reviews. This elitism needs to be stamped out early. My dad had to take pics of my little sis’s heart opp for them to stop their ranting about him making sure she took sufficient time off to fully recover after illness.
What a time to be alive. IS EVERYONE ASLEEP?! https://t.co/TrFHRSdiY5
@GeorgieAgass @KateBurkeNHS He then ended by musing: ‘yes I think my wife in some ways regrets it as she never progressed her career’. Ah so long as you’re happy though mate 🤦🏻‍♀️

@KateBurkeNHS A man I know from a MBA-style course I did whilst preggers with no.1 rabbited on at a recent drinks about how this is the best time of your life, how his wife gave up work, and how he can’t imagine one of you not ‘always being there’...can we pls just starting saying: ‘Fuck Off’
Interesting stuff 🤓 https://t.co/pmMN1LegUf

It is bloody hard balancing work and family, @StylistMagazine for brings back to life most vividly that it has been ever thus with this flash back to the 1770s on forgotten women. Two kids, an imprisoned husband and extreme poverty does not a poem make. #feminism https://t.co/mhUrQcFkwM

Working remotely sounds great, but it’s easy to fall into the rut of working in a pile of dirty washing. Sometimes it’s nice to relocate to somewhere fancy. Just because you can. Thank you for the tea, coffee and Christmas 🎄 @CorinthiaLondon https://t.co/1f05J6jG8a
